verses.kjv: But Job answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Job responded:

verses.kjv: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!
verses.ct: "If only my anguish could be properly measured, and all my suffering placed on a scale together!

verses.kjv: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.
verses.ct: It would outweigh the sand of the ocean — that's why my words come out so reckless.

verses.kjv: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
verses.ct: The arrows of the Almighty have pierced me, and their poison drains my spirit. God's terrors are lined up against me like an army.

verses.kjv: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?
verses.ct: Does a wild donkey cry out when it has plenty of grass? Does an ox moan over a full feeding trough?

verses.kjv: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
verses.ct: Can tasteless food be eaten without salt? Is there any flavor in the white of an egg?

verses.kjv: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.
verses.ct: The things my soul refuses to touch — those are now the disgusting food I'm forced to eat.

verses.kjv: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
verses.ct: If only I could get what I'm asking for! If only God would give me what I desperately want!

verses.kjv: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
verses.ct: I wish God would just crush me, that he would release his hand and end my life!

verses.kjv: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
verses.ct: At least that would give me some comfort — I would even find strength in unrelenting pain — because I have never denied the words of the Holy One.

verses.kjv: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?
verses.ct: What strength do I have left to keep hoping? What future is there that would make me want to keep living?

verses.kjv: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?
verses.ct: Am I made of rock? Is my body made of bronze?

verses.kjv: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?
verses.ct: I have no power left to help myself, and every resource has been stripped away from me.

verses.kjv: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
verses.ct: A person who is suffering deserves loyalty from his friends, even if he has abandoned his wholehearted dedication to the Almighty.

verses.kjv: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;
verses.ct: But my brothers have been as unreliable as seasonal streams — like riverbeds that overflow and then disappear.

verses.kjv: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:
verses.ct: They run dark with melting ice and swollen with hidden snow,

verses.kjv: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
verses.ct: but when the heat comes, they dry up — in the scorching weather, they vanish completely.

verses.kjv: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.
verses.ct: Caravans turn off their routes to find them, but they wander into the wasteland and die.

verses.kjv: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.
verses.ct: The travelers from Tema searched for water; the merchants of Sheba counted on finding it.

verses.kjv: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.
verses.ct: They were devastated because they had been so confident. They arrived at the spot only to be bitterly disappointed.

verses.kjv: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.
verses.ct: That's exactly what you've become to me — nothing. You see my terrible condition and it scares you away.

verses.kjv: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?
verses.ct: Did I ever ask you, 'Give me something'? Or, 'Use your wealth to pay a ransom for me'?

verses.kjv: Or, Deliver me from the enemy’s hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?
verses.ct: Or, 'Rescue me from an enemy's grip'? Or, 'Save me from the power of ruthless people'?

verses.kjv: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
verses.ct: Teach me, and I'll be quiet. Show me where I've gone wrong, and I'll accept it.

verses.kjv: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?
verses.ct: Honest words carry real weight! But what exactly do your arguments prove?

verses.kjv: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?
verses.ct: Do you think you can criticize my words — treating the desperate cries of a broken man as nothing but hot air?

verses.kjv: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.
verses.ct: You would even gamble over an orphan and bargain away your own friend!

verses.kjv: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.
verses.ct: So now, please — look me in the face. It will be obvious to you whether I'm lying.

verses.kjv: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.
verses.ct: Reconsider, please — don't let injustice stand. Think again, because my integrity is at stake.

verses.kjv: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?
verses.ct: Is there anything wicked on my tongue? Can't I tell the difference between what's right and what's twisted?"
